mods.abstract: FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD -- RAN away from the subscriber the 14th of February, the black man RUFFIN, aged about 28 years; stout built; supposed to be about 5 feet 7 inches high; has good teeth; stoops a little when walking; no marks recollected; speaks English only; he can write a little and might likely write himself a pass. This boy has been employed on the Ocean line of towboats since 1851 as fireman; he is well known in the Third District. Captains of steamboats and ships are requested not to emply him. The above reward will be paid to any one lodging said man in jail, or delivering him to JOSEPH MAYBERRY, 141 Greatmen st. I will also give FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD for such information as will convict the person or persons that harbourr him. JOSEPH MAYBERRY. fe24 1m
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
